metadata.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts victim singing a sad folk song. This is one of the brain jars that can be found in the tutorial area of the game.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "Dark Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.- This jar is one of the two jars that can be found in the tutorial level (Nautiloid).

2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
2.context: NodeContext: Eerily humming opening bars of song that was just song

4.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
4.text:
Oh, my darling Carolina
how I'd love to wine and dine ya
but you chose my foolish brother over me...
4.context: NodeContext: singing (Note: the writer, Sarah Baylus, says in the Jira thread that she will pass the melody for the voice talent to follow)

3.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
3.text:
And when you two are wed
Well, my heart will be but dead
For my sister you will sadly, surely be.

1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
1.text:
But my brother, he's a loser
And I take you for a chooser
So perhaps one day you'll leave him high and dry.

0.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
0.text:
And if you choose another
What's more loving than a brother
Yes, a stand-up, homely, gentle sort of guy.
